name: Experience Builder
author: Monoloop

sections.description:
From static to personalized site experience

Most websites still treat all visitors the same. First time visitors get the same experience as frequent visitors with hundreds of prior visits. High value visitors get the same as low value visitors � you get the picture, right?
If you want to fundamentally increase the relevance of your content to the people who consumes it � you need to adapt it to the individual visitor � one visitor at a time. Experience Builder enable you to do just that.

Profile your visitors into audiences

Experience Builder automatically profile your site visitors, it helps you segment them into audiences. Visitor profiles can be extended using Trackers and any combination of profile information can be used to trigger content variations.

Create variations inline inside WordPress

Build your personalized site experience where you already create your content. Experience Builder for WordPress extends the WordPress user interface with a new Orchestrator tab where you select pages, select and create content variations using inline editing and define the rules that trigger them.

Targeted Experiences

Using Experiences – you can target a single audience with experiences covering multiple content elements across multiple pages. You get real time reporting on how your experience impact your site goals. Goals can be both pages or profile conditions.

Features:

  • Omnichannel profiling supporting cross channel experiences.
  • Real Time segmentation of site visitors.
  • Inline content creation.
  • Experiences – journeys designed against specific visitor audiences across one or many pages.
  • Goals – pages or profile conditions.
  • Visual test bench
  • Full RESTfull API

`
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/plugin-name directory, or install the plugin through the WordPress plugins screen directly.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ screen in WordPress.
  3. Go to Settings/Monoloop Settings.
  4. Create a Monoloop account.
  5. Click confirmation link in confirmation email.
sections.faq:
Does this plugin impact my pageload speed?

No. Our script is asyncrone so all assets are loading in parallel as fast as they can.

If I enable Anti-Flicker, will it impact pageload speed?

No. Anti-Flicker only hides the page content for a configurable time in oder for content injected by Monoloop to be rendered in the background. All your page assets are loading as usual.

Do I own the profiledata from my visitors?

Yes. You are the sole owner of the tracked information. We never share or snoop.

Is the Privacy Center widget mandatory

Yes. Privacy Center is to ensure we are complying with data regulation across the US and EU. For Free accounts Privacy Center is loaded on all pages. For paid accounts it is possible to select where to load the privacy center or redirect to a page where you offer the visitor the same options as the Privacy Center.

What happens if my site exceed the volume in the Free plan?

When included traffic is exceeded Monoloop will stop tracking your site visitors and personalize their site experience. We will send you a email notifying you that your account is running low and a email when Monoloop is disabled. Your account is automatically topped up again every 30 days and your tracking will resume when account is again positive. Optionally you can signup for the paid plan and use account top up to any site volume you require.

Will I have to change settings if moving from Free to Paid plan?

No. Only your options are changed with the switch.
sections.changelog:
1.4.3

  • Fixed cookie issue

1.4.2

  • Fixed login issue

1.4.1

  • Bug fixed

1.4

  • Fixed x-frame-options in placement window.

1.3

  • Support SPA configurations
  • Remove deprecate configurations

1.2

  • Support for single page applications

  • Support for dynamic site content

  • New configuration options for single page applications
  • Predefined Audiences based on customer lifecycle model
  • New Funnel visualization of defined audiences

1.1

  • Predefined trackers for categories, product, search, purchase, basket, forms
  • Full http/https support
  • Notice for first time signup

1.0

  • Initial Release

short_description: Profile your visitors and transform your static site into a dynamic personalized experience.

screenshot-2.png: New page editing option with Orchestrator tab.
screenshot-3.png: Test experience variations directly in Orchestator tab.
screenshot-4.png: Save experience and decide what part of your site it should cover.
screenshot-5.png: Conditional builder defines your target audience. Full access to deep visitor profile information.
screenshot-6.png: Inline editing with easy to follow wizards walk you through the creation flow.
screenshot-7.png: Full overview of active and inactive experiences.
screenshot-8.png: Full overview of active and inactive audience segments.

screenshot-10.png: Full overview of active and inactive goals and goal type.
screenshot-11.png: Real time reporting of active Audiences.
